page.title: 04ANNUAL FETE AND DOG SHOW
page.content: The Fete and Dog Show at the Civic Hall is an annual event organised by the Didcot Girl Guides. There is a big raffle at the end and in 1985 the first prize was 50 pounds. Each Guide pack distributes a prize. The Fete consists of various stalls, both games and sales, most of them organized by local Guide packs. The Dog Show is judged in different categories: for example dog most like its owner, best behaved dog and best child handler. There are 12 classes of dog breed altogether, each class being made up of different breeds. The Dog Show opens at 1.00 and finishes at 4.00. The Fete starts at the same time as the Dog Show and finishes at 4.30.
